abstract.p: International Amateur Boxing Assn suspends several referees and judges from boxing finals at Goodwill Games; acts on Russian complaint of bias; Russian boxers lost several close decisions (S)

block.p: The International Amateur Boxing Association suspended two referee/judges, as well as one judge and one referee from the boxing finals at the Goodwill Games at the Theater at Madison Square Garden yesterday afternoon. The suspensions followed a formal protest by the Russian Boxing Federation and its delegation and an evaluation of the officiating.

The Russian delegation believed that the judges and referees who were suspended were biased against its boxers. Macario Sosa of Guatemala and Alfredo Toledo of Cuba were the referee/judges suspended. Per-Olof Larsson of Sweden was the referee and Dieter Mika of Germany was the judge who was suspended.

The International Amateur Boxing Association suspended two referee/judges, as well as one judge and one referee from the boxing finals at the Goodwill Games at the Theater at Madison Square Garden yesterday afternoon. The suspensions followed a formal protest by the Russian Boxing Federation and its delegation and an evaluation of the officiating.

The Russian delegation believed that the judges and referees who were suspended were biased against its boxers. Macario Sosa of Guatemala and Alfredo Toledo of Cuba were the referee/judges suspended. Per-Olof Larsson of Sweden was the referee and Dieter Mika of Germany was the judge who was suspended.

The Russian delegation was upset that its boxers had lost some close decisions in bouts on Wednesday and Thursday, and in a written protest yesterday morning it threatened to boycott the finals and take its team home, according to Arthur Tunstall, a technical delegate for the international association from Australia.
Maikro Romero of Cuba defeated Aleksan Nalbaniyan of Russia, 10-5, last night, landing punches at will with overhand rights.

Mario Kindelan of Cuba defeated Jacob Hudson of Augusta, Ga., 13-4, to win the gold medal in the 132-pound division. Andrei Mishin of Russia outgunned, outboxed and outclassed Larry Mosley of Los Angeles to win the gold medal in the 147-pound division.
